instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS: What is PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS? PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor to components that create power rails for the GPU. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power fan spin 3 secondes and stop loop
threads.message:
Before replacing gpu i've heated gpu and board starts ok

After replacing gpu twice, same probem, fan spin 3second and stop loop

Good light, orange light ok

Glue under vram removed before and checked balls after

Garbage gpu?

No composant missing or burned

<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS</SIGNAL> 12.56V

Another point to check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power fan spin 3 secondes and stop loop
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0v (short to gnd) :/

gpu vcore up to 1v about and 0 when fan stop

<SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_HI_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 0.8V

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> up to 3v about (too fast for read next)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power fan spin 3 secondes and stop loop
threads.message:
1) Where did you get the GPU and which date code?
2) You can remove the GPU, these boards will boot up without one, there will of course be no image.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power fan spin 3 secondes and stop loop
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> always 0V?
You can try to pass with your soldering iron some leaded solder at the pins of <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power fan spin 3 secondes and stop loop
threads.message:
[QUOTE="premtec, post: 22762"]<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> always 0V?
You can try to pass with your soldering iron some leaded solder at the pins of <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>[/QUOTE]

Why would you do that? Makes no sense that would be an issue after GPU replacement. CPU need to talk to <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> to enable it, CPU is dead so no Vcore.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power fan spin 3 secondes and stop loop
threads.message: and how CPU died after GPU replacement?
